fact: India generates over 3.2 million tonnes of e-waste annually, making it the 3rd largest e-waste producer globally.
A single smartphone contains over 40 elements including gold, silver, copper, and rare earth metals.
Recycling 1 million laptops saves energy equivalent to electricity used by 3,657 US homes in a year.
Lead from old CRT monitors can contaminate groundwater and cause serious health issues if not disposed properly.
Lithium batteries can catch fire if damaged or improperly disposed. Always take them to authorized recyclers.
Only 20% of global e-waste is formally recycled. The rest ends up in landfills or informal recycling.
E-waste contains toxic substances but also precious metals worth $57 billion globally if properly recovered.
India's E-Waste Management Rules 2016 mandate Extended Producer Responsibility for electronics manufacturers.
